messages.content:
Seven red apples and two green apples are in the basket.
How many apples are in the basket?

Ellen has six more balls than Marin. Marin has nine balls.
How many balls does Ellen have?

Janet has nine oranges and Sharon has seven oranges.
How many oranges do Janet and Sharon have together?

Allan brought two balloons and Jake brought four balloons to the park.
How many balloons did Allan and Jake have in the park?

Adam has five more apples than Jackie. Jackie has nine apples.
How many apples does Adam have?

Brian has four more plums than Paul. Paul has seven plums.
How many plums does Brian have?

Sandra took six cups of coffee and Marcie took two cups of coffee.
How many cups of coffee did Sandra and Marcie take in total?

17 plums were in the basket. More plums were added to the basket. Now there are 21 plums.
How many plums were added to the basket?

14 red plums and four green plums are in the basket.
How many plums are in the basket?

Marin has nine apples and Donald has two apples.
How many apples do Marin and Donald have together?

46 apples were in the basket. 22 are red and the rest are green.
How many apples are green?

Five red peaches and 14 green peaches are in the basket.
How many peaches are in the basket?

20 peaches are in the basket. 25 more peaches are put in the basket.
How many peaches are in the basket now?

Two marbles are in the basket. Two marbles are taken out of the basket.
How many marbles are in the basket now?

Eight balls were in the basket. Some of the balls were removed from the basket. Now there are six balls.
How many balls were removed from the basket?

Some oranges were in the basket. Five oranges were taken from the basket. Now there are three oranges.
How many oranges were in the basket before some of the oranges were taken?

Jake has six fewer peaches than Steven. Steven has 13 peaches.
How many peaches does Jake have?

David has zero fewer apples than Marin. Marin has three apples.
How many apples does David have?

Jake has 34 fewer balls than Audrey. Audrey has 41 balls.
How many balls does Jake have?

Brian has zero fewer oranges than Marcie. Marcie has 12 oranges.
How many oranges does Brian have?

2 birds were sitting on the fence. 4 more birds came to join them.
How many birds are sitting on the fence?

You have 7 cookies and you ate 2 of them.
How many cookies do you have left?

You have collected 7 crickets.
How many more crickets do you need to collect to have 11 crickets?

4 birds are sitting on a branch. 1 flies away.
How many birds are left on the branch?

3 raccoons are playing in the woods. 2 go home to eat dinner.
How many raccoons are left in the woods?

1 lonely pigeons was eating breadcrumbs. Another pigeon came to eat breadcrumbs, too.
How many pigeons are eating breadcrumbs now?

3 owls were sitting on the fence. 2 more owls joined them.
How many owls are on the fence now?

2 beavers were working on their home. 1 went for a swim.
How many beavers are still working on their home?

2 toucans are sitting on a tree limb. 1 more toucan joins them.
How many toucans in all?

Mrs. Hilt has two pennies, two dimes, and two nickels. Jacob has four pennies, one nickel, and one dime.
Who has more money?
2*1  (cent)+2 (dime)*10 (cent/dime) +2 (nickel)*5 (cent/nickel)=32 cents(Mrs. Hilt) > 4*1 (cent)+1 (nickel)*5 (cent/nickel) +1  (dime)*10 (cent/dime)=19 cents(Jacob)

Mrs. Hilt has two pennies, two dimes, and two nickels. Jacob has four pennies, one nickel, and one dime.
How much more?
(2*1  (cent)+2 (dime)*10 (cent/dime) +2 (nickel)*5 (cent/nickel)) - (4*1 (cent)+1 (nickel)*5 (cent/nickel) +1  (dime)*10 (cent/dime)) = 13 (cent)

Mrs. Hilt found a quarter, 1 dime, and 2 nickels.
How much money did she find?
1 (quarter)*25 (cent/quarter) + 1 (dime)*10 (cent/dime) + 2 (nickel)*5 (cent/nickel) = 45 (cent)

Mrs. Hilt's favorite first grade classes are baking muffins. Mrs. Brier's class bakes 18 muffins, Mrs. MacAdams's class bakes 20 muffins, and Mrs. Flannery's class bakes 17 muffins.
How many muffins does first grade bake in all?

Mrs. Hilt bought a yoyo for 24 cents and a whistle for 14 cents.
How much did she spend in all for the two toys?

Mrs. Hilt made 5 Rice Krispie Treats. She used 8 large marshmallows and 10 mini marshmallows.
How many marshmallows did she use altogether?

At Mrs. Hilt's house, there was 29 inches of snow, and Brecknock Elementary School received 17 inches of snow.
How much more snow did Mrs. Hilt's house have?

Mrs. Hilt has $10. She spends $3 on a toy truck and $2 on a pencil case.
How much money does she have left?

Mrs. Hilt reads 5 books a day.
How many books does she read in 3 days?

Mrs. Hilt saw 2 dogs and 2 chickens.
How many animal legs did she see?

Mrs. Hilt saw 3 bugs eat two flowers each.
How many flowers total did the bugs eat?

Mrs. Hilt has 15 friends. She can only take 8 of her friends to the movies.
How many friends can't go to the movies?

Mrs. Hilt ran 3 miles on Monday, 2 miles on Wednesday, and 7 miles on Friday.
How many total miles did she run that week?

Mrs. Hilt picked up a book that has 17 pages in it. She read 11 of the pages.
How many pages did she have left to read?

Mrs. Hilt had 15 cents. She bought a pencil for 11 cents.
How much money did she have left?

Mrs. Hilt met 15 friends. Nine of the friends were carrying pears. The rest were carrying oranges.
How many friends were carrying oranges?

Mrs. Hilt spent 25 cents on one caramel apple and 15 cents on one ice cream cone.
How much more did the apple cost?

Mrs. Hilt bought 2 pizzas. Each pizza had 8 slices.
How many total slices of pizza did she have?

Mrs. Hilt read 2 books per day.
How many books did she read in one week?

Mrs. Hilt ate 5 apples every hour.
How many apples had she eaten at the end of 3 hours?

Mrs. Hilt gave 2 pieces of candy to each student in the group. The group had a total of 9 students in it.
How many pieces of candy did Mrs. Hilt give away?

Mary's mom is getting ready for Mary's birthday party. She blew up 6 balloons this morning and 5 balloons this afternoon.
How many balloons did she blow up in all?

Shelby's teacher gives out gold stars for great math work. Yesterday, Shelby earned 4 gold stars. Today, she earned 3 more.
How many gold stars did Shelby earn in all?

The Litter Patrol picked up 10 glass bottles and 8 aluminum cans on Saturday.
How many pieces of litter did they pick up altogether?

Millie had 9 bracelets. She lost 2 of them.
How many bracelets does Millie have left?

Sammy has 9 math problems to do for homework. He has already finished 2 of them.
How many math problems does Sammy have left?

There were 10 students riding on the school bus. At the first stop, 3 students got off of the bus.
How many students are left on the bus?

There were 8 ducks swimming in the pond. 3 ducks flew away.
How many ducks are still swimming in the pond?

There are 83 trees in a park. 36 of them willows and the rest are oaks.
How many more oaks than willows are there in the park?

Ryan collected 89 leaves. He lost 24 leaves and threw away 43 leaves.
How many leaves did Ryan have left?

Sam has 58 Power Ranger stickers. He bundles them up in two boxes. If there are 23 Power Ranger stickers in the first box,
how many more Power Ranger stickers are there in the second box than the first box?

Beryl has 88 radishes. She puts them into two baskets. If there are 37 radishes in the first basket,
how many more radishes are there in the second basket than the first?

There are 56 students in the class. The teacher wants to split them into two groups. The first group has 24 students.
How many more students will there be in the second group?

The total weight of Jack and Sam is 96 pounds. If Jack weighs 52 pounds,
how much heavier is Jack than Sam?

Antonia has 79 Barbie Dolls. She packs away them in two wardrobes. If there are 35 Barbie Dolls in the first wardrobe,
how many more Barbie Dolls are there in the second wardrobe than the first?

Adam has two oranges. Michele has two oranges.
What's the difference of the number of Adam's oranges and Michele's oranges?

Audrey has 26 peaches. Paul has 48 peaches.
What's the difference of the number of Audrey's peaches and Paul's peaches?

Sharon has seven plums. Allan has 10 plums.
What's the difference of the number of Sharon's plums and Allan's plums?

You have 7 balloons and your friend has 5 balloons.
What's the difference of the number of your balloons and your friend's balloons?

There are 6 birds and 3 nests.
What's the difference of the number of birds and nests over there?

There are 5 flowers and 3 bees.
What's the difference of the number of flowers and bees over there?

There are 4 squirrels in a tree with 2 nuts.
What's the difference of the number of squirrels and nuts over there?

For Halloween Frank got fifteen pounds of candy. If he gave eight pounds to Nancy,
what's the difference between the pounds of Frank's candy before he gave Nancy and he gave to?

Paige had 2 pencils in her desk, 2 in her backpack and 15 at home.
What's the difference between the number of pencils in Paige's backpack and at Paige's home?

Oliver was weighing boxes for moving. The first was 2 pounds, the second was 3 pounds and the last was 13 pounds.
What's the difference between the weight of the first box and the third box?

Haley had 2 dollars. If she got 13 more dollars in total for doing chores and her birthday,
what's the difference between the number of dollars before Haley got money and she got from events?

A farmer had seventeen tomatoes from his garden. If he picked nine of them,
what's the difference between the number of tomatoes before picking and he picked?

Dave was picking up sticks from his yard. He picked up fourteen but there were still four left.
What's the difference between the number of sticks that Dave picked up and the left?

A waiter had nineteen customers. After some left he still had four customers.
What's the difference between the number of customers before leaving and after leaving?

While playing a video game Victor lost fourteen lives. Now he has two lives.
What's the difference between the number of the lives that Victor lost and now?

Oliver had sixteen cherries. After eating some, he had six left.
What's the difference between the number of cherries that Oliver had before eating and the left after eating?

A furniture store had fifteen chairs. After selling some, there was three left.
What's the difference between the number of chairs before selling and the left?

Tom used 2 batteries on his flashlights, 15 in his toys and 2 in his controllers.
What's the difference between the number of Tom's batteries on flashlights and in toys?

Zoe picked five apples from her tree. Now the tree has six apples still on it.
What's the difference between the number of apples Zoe picked and now the tree has?

A museum had fourteen paintings. After they got rid of some, they had four left.
What's the difference between the number of paintings before they got rid of and the left?

A clown had sixteen balloons. He gave four away at a party.
What's the difference between the number of balloons the clown had in the beginning and he gave away at a party?

For a party Janet bought some cupcakes. She bought 2 chocolate, 13 vanilla and 2 strawberry.
What's the difference between the number of cupcakes of chocolate flavor and the vanilla flavor?

Amy had some candy. She gave her friend six pieces and had five left.
What's the difference between of the pieces of candy Amy gave away and the left?

A pet store took ten birds out of a cage and had nine still left inside.
How many birds were in the cage to start with?

Rachel picked three apples from her tree. Now the tree has four apples still on it.
How many apples did the tree have to begin with?

Paige raised fifteen goldfish in the pond but stray cats loved eating them. Now she has four left.
How many goldfish disappeared?

Cody cooked fourteen dumplings. He ate seven.
How many dumplings does Cody have now?

Sarah could send ten text messages a day. If she sent eight,
how many text messages does she have left she can send?

Debby had twelve pieces of candy. After eating some, she had three pieces.
How many pieces did Debby eat?

Frank had $16. After buying some new toys he had $8 left.
How much did he spend on toys?

Robin's hair was fifteen inches long. If she cut off five inches,
how long is her hair now?

At the fair Megan had $17 to spend. She spent $6 on rides.
How much money does she have left?

There were nine kinds of sandwiches on the menu. Unfortunately, five of them had been sold out,
how many kinds of sandwiches do they actually provide now?

A chef had sixteen apples. After making a pie he had seven left.
How many apples did he use in the pie?

The book fair sold four posters. Now they have two posters left.
How many posters did they have to begin with?

Ned ordered some pizzas for a party. During the party four were eaten. Now he has seven left.
How many pizzas did Ned order for the party?

A baker sold twelve cakes. Now he has three cakes.
How many cakes did the baker have to start with?

Jerry had $18. He spent $6 on new video games.
How much money does he have now?

Dave had sixteen apps on his phone. After deleting some, he had eight left.
How many apps did he delete?

Isabel had sixteen bottles of water. After a week she had seven left.
How many did she drink?

A waiter had eighteen customers. If six left,
how many customers would the waiter still have?

Megan had seventeen bottles of water. If she drank three of them,
how many bottles would Megan have left?

Jenny was told to clean up her room in fourteen days or she could not go to her best friend's birthday party. It is three days left but Jenny has cleaned up her room.
How many days did she spend?

Maria took sixteen fish out of her fish tank. Now there are three fish in the tank.
How many fish were in the tank to start with?

A waiter had fourteen customers. After some left he still had three customers.
How many customers left?

Paige had eleven pencils. After using some she had four left.
How many did she use?

Cody had a bag of marbles. Later he gave five to his brother. Now Cody has seven marbles.
How many marbles did Cody have to start with?

A museum had thirteen paintings. If they got rid of eight of them,
how many pictures would they have left?

A chef used fifteen apples to make a pie. Now he has four apples left.
How many apples did he have before he made the pie?

Amy's hair was eleven inches long. After a haircut it was seven inches long.
How much did she cut off?

Megan gave seven acorns to her sister. Now Megan has nine acorns left.
How many acorns did Megan have in the beginning?

A chef had fourteen apples. If he used eight of them to make a pie,
how many apples would he still have?

For Halloween Will got fifteen pounds of candy. After giving some to Haley, he had nine pounds left.
How many pounds did he give to Haley?

Amy had twelve pencils. If she used four of them,
how many would she have left?

Victor had nineteen apps on his phone. He deleted eight of them.
How many apps does Victor have left?

Edward spent $13. Now he has $6.
How much did Edward have before he spent his money?

A package had eighteen cookies in it. After eating some there were nine left.
How many were eaten?

A tape was thirteen meters long. Haley used some to seal cartons. Now the tape is six meters long.
How much tape did she use?

A furniture store had fifteen chairs. After selling some, there was three left.
How many chairs did they sell?

Rachel took two dollars from her piggy bank. Now she has three dollars in her piggy bank.
How much money was originally in there?

Ned gave away thirteen of his video games to a friend. Now Ned has six games.
How many games did Ned have before he gave the games away?

For a party Cody bought eleven cupcakes. After the party he had two left.
How many were eaten at the party?

Jerry had eleven cherries. He ate eight of them.
How many cherries does Jerry have left?

At the arcade Dave had won thirteen tickets. If he used six to buy some toys,
how many tickets did Dave have left?

Sally memorized eight poems. After some time she could only recite three of them.
How many poems did she forget?

Frank got fifteen pounds of mushroom for family barbecue. If they ate eight pounds,
how many pounds were left?

Adam put eighteen items in the shopping cart. After deleting some, he had eight left.
How many items did Adam delete?

Kaleb has seventeen shirts. If he got rid of seven of them,
how many shirts would Kaleb have?

While playing a game Edward had fifteen lives. He lost eight lives on a hard level.
How many lives does he have left?

A group was sitting at a lunch table. After finishing, six people left and there were five left at the table.
How many people were at the table to start with?

A clown had sixteen balloons. He gave four away at a party.
How many balloons does he still have?

Haley grew sixteen trees in her backyard. After a typhoon five died.
How many trees does she have left?

Debby owned thirteen DVDs. If she sold six of them,
how many would she have left?

The host prepared nineteen cakes for the party. After the party he had nine left.
How many cakes did people eat in the party?

Frank had thirteen boxes. If he filled eight with toys,
how many boxes does he still have?

On Friday a pizza store sold 2 pepperoni, 6 bacon and 6 cheese pizzas.
How many pizzas did they sell total?

In a game you start with 2 lives. If you got 6 extra lives in the first level and 11 more in the second,
how many lives would you have?

A chef was making pies. He made 2 apple, 4 pecan and 7 pumpkin pies.
How many pies did he make total?

A pet store had 2 white cats, 10 black cats and 3 gray cats.
How many cats did they have total?

Amy had 2 dollars. If she got 13 more dollars for doing chores and 3 more for her birthday,
how much money does she have now?

At the fair Rachel spent 2 dollars on rides, 8 dollars on games and 2 dollars on food.
How much money did she spend total?

Paige had 2 pencils in her desk, 2 in her backpack and 15 at home.
How many pencils does Paige have?

Jerry was weighing boxes for moving. The first was 2 pounds, the second was 11 pounds and the last was 5 pounds.
What is the combined weight of all three boxes?

While playing a trivia game, Team A scored 2 points, Team B scored 9 points and Team C scored 4 points.
How many points were scored total?

A chef bought 2 purple grapes and 2 green grapes. If he already had 3 grapes,
how many grapes does he have now?

In the freezer there are 2 grape popsicles, 13 cherry popsicles and 2 banana popsicles.
How many popsicles are there total?

On Monday Debby jogged 2 kilometers. On Tuesday she jogged 5 kilometers and on Wednesday she jogged 9.
How many kilometers did she jog total?

A pet store had 2 dogs. On Sunday they got 5 more. On Monday they got 3 more.
How many dogs does the pet store have now?

For lunch, 2 students selected chocolate milk, 15 selected strawberry milk and 3 selected regular milk.
How many milks were taken total?

Tom already had 2 pieces of candy. His friend gave him 7 more and then Tom bought another 10.
How many pieces does Tom have now?

A farmer planted 2 tomato seeds, 10 cucumber seeds and 3 pumpkin seeds.
How many seeds did he plant all together?

Frank was reading a book. He read 2 pages at school, 3 on the bus and 3 at home.
How many pages did Frank read?

Tom used 2 batteries on his flashlights, 15 in his toys and 2 in his controllers.
How many batteries did Tom use?

While organizing her files, Bianca deleted 2 pictures, 8 songs and 7 text files.
What is the total number of files she deleted?

Roger had 2 new crayons, 4 used crayons and 8 broken crayons.
How many crayons did Roger have total?

For a new year's party 2 red balloons, 12 green balloons and 6 white balloons were used.
What is the total number of balloons used?

A vet was weighing 3 cats. The first weighed 2 pounds. The second weighed 7 pounds and the last weighed 4 pounds.
What is their combined weight?

Henry already had 5 dollars, but earned another 2 dollars doing chores. His friend had 13 dollars. If they put their money together,
how much would they have?

Tom read 2 books in May, 6 in June and 10 in July.
How many books did Tom read?

On a table there were 2 green apples, 3 red apples and 14 yellow apples.
How many apples were on the table?

At the arcade Debby spent 2 tickets on a hat, 10 on a stuffed animal and 2 on a yoyo.
How many tickets did she spend total?

A gas station sold 2 boxes of chocolate candy, 5 boxes of sugar candy and 2 boxes of gum.
What is the total number of boxes they sold?

A chef was making soups. She made 2 bowls of chicken soup, 2 bowls of mushroom soup and 7 bowls of tomato soup.
How many bowls of soup did she make total?

Henry was playing tic-tac-toe. He won 2 times, lost 2 times and it was a draw 10 times.
How many times did Henry play?

An artist painted 2 pictures in June. He painted 2 more in July and in August he painted 9.
How many pictures did he paint total?

Henry bought 2 new fireworks and his friend bought 3. If they already had 6 saved from last year,
how many do they have now?

At the bank, a customer turned in 2 dimes, 2 nickels and 7 quarters.
What is the total number of coins the customer turned in?

For a party Janet bought some cupcakes. She bought 2 chocolate, 13 vanilla and 2 strawberry.
How many cupcakes did she buy?

During a sale, a shoe store sold 2 pairs of sneakers, 4 pairs of sandals and 11 pairs of boots.
How many pairs of shoes did the store sell?

Haley watched TV for six hours on Saturday and three hours on Sunday.
How many hours did Haley watch TV total?

Jerry walked nine miles on Monday and nine more on Tuesday.
How many miles did Jerry walk?

Gwen had ten fish and her sister had five fish.
How many fish did they have total?

Victor had $10. For his allowance he got another $8.
How much money does he have total?

For Halloween Frank got ten pounds of candy and Gwen got seven pounds of candy.
What is the combined weight they received?

Roger was packing up his old toys. He filled eleven boxes with action figures and two boxes with old games.
How many boxes did he pack total?

A store sold eight cold drinks and three hot drinks.
How many drinks did they sell total?

A pet store had six kittens. If they got another three kittens,
how many would they have total?

Faye had seven books. If she bought twelve more at a yard sale,
how many would she have total?

John has twelve shirts. Later he bought four more shirts.
How many shirts does John have total?

Robin drank seven bottles of water in the morning and seven in the afternoon.
How many bottles did Robin drink total?

Roger went to the movies fifteen times last year and three times this year.
How many times did Roger go to the movies all together?

Olivia picked up sixteen pieces of paper from the floor. If Edward picked up three pieces,
how many did they pick up total?

Victor had nine books. During the book fair he bought three more.
How many books did Victor have total?

Katie had twelve pencils in her desk and three more in her backpack.
How many did she have total?

Debby had twelve pounds of flour. If she bought another four pounds,
how many pounds would she have total?

At the fair Haley went on six rides in the day and three at night.
How many rides did Haley go on total?

Lana had eleven DS games. If she bought two more games,
how many would she have total?

Jerry owned seven video games. For his birthday he got two more.
How many games did Jerry have total?

A clown gave away eleven balloons to girls and three balloons to boys.
How many balloons did he give away total?

There were ten people on the bus. At the next stop three more people got on the bus.
How many people are there on the bus now?

Oliver collected two seashells from the beach on Monday and two more on Tuesday.
How many seashells did Oliver collect all together?
